home.welcome: Junior Software Developer Seeking Full-Stack & Backend Roles in Antwerpen
home.description: A recent graduate in Programming, I'm actively seeking a Junior Full-Stack or Backend Developer position in the Antwerpen, Belgium area. This portfolio showcases my practical skills, including hands-on experience gained from my recent software development internship—detailed further in my internship blog. I'm eager to contribute to innovative projects and grow as a developer.
home.blogSectionIntro: My internship blog offers a week-by-week chronicle of my development journey, detailing practical problem-solving, technology adoption (React, PostgreSQL, Fastify), and overall growth as a software developer. It's a transparent look at my hands-on experience.
home.techDescription: My core technical stack, ready for building and maintaining applications.
home.projectsDescription: Explore a selection of my key projects, showcasing practical application of my technical skills and problem-solving abilities, including work from my recent software development internship.
home.experienceDescription: My professional journey in the tech industry so far, highlighting relevant development work and other valuable experience.
home.skillsDescription: Key technical and soft skills I bring to development projects, honed during my studies and practical internship experience.
home.educationDescription: My formal education in information technology.

experienceDescriptions.amotek: Completed a full-stack software development internship, working on the AmoTrack project. Gained hands-on experience building features using React (frontend) and Fastify with PostgreSQL/Drizzle (backend). Involved in the full development lifecycle, including contributing to architecture discussions and utilizing modern development workflows.
experienceDescriptions.digipolis: Provided ICT support, gaining foundational experience in system setup, network assistance, and problem-solving in a professional IT environment. Developed strong communication and client interaction skills.

about.title: About Me: Junior Full-Stack & Backend Developer
about.educationText: I am currently completing my Graduate Programming degree at AP Hogeschool, building a strong foundation in both frontend and backend development. While I have a strong interest and aptitude for backend logic and architecture, I am also dedicated to strengthening my frontend skills to be able to contribute effectively across the full stack and understand complete application development.
about.languagesText: As a native Spanish speaker, fluent in Dutch, and comfortable working in English, I am well-equipped for collaboration in diverse, international teams and able to easily access and understand technical resources in multiple languages.
about.aiTitle: My Approach to AI in Development
about.aiPhilosophyText: I view AI as a powerful tool that can enhance developer productivity—excellent for suggesting code improvements, identifying potential issues, and accelerating routine tasks—while emphasizing that the developer must retain full control, understanding, and responsibility for the final code.
about.aiApproach: How I Use It in Practice
about.aiApproachText: My primary uses for AI include generating code suggestions, refining existing code solutions, and assisting with documentation and explanations. I strictly adhere to best practices regarding data privacy and intellectual property, ensuring no private or sensitive project code is shared with AI tools.
about.aiExample: For instance, while developing this portfolio, I utilized AI for initial layout ideas and debugging support, but all architectural decisions, code implementation, and final content were entirely my own work.
about.goalsText: I aspire to become a proficient Full-Stack Developer, with a particular interest in backend systems. My focus extends beyond just building new features; I am keen on maintaining, optimizing, and ensuring the long-term health and efficiency of existing systems. This includes writing clean, maintainable code and contributing to robust architectures.
about.goalsPhilosophy: Contributing to the longevity and reliability of software is as crucial as its initial creation. I value future-proof design and maintainable codebases.
about.methodsText1: I build my knowledge base by continuously learning new technologies while simultaneously deepening my understanding of fundamental programming principles and established best practices. This approach helps me find a balance between exploring innovation and applying proven solutions effectively.
about.methodsText2: I learn through books like ‘Clean Code’, 'Head First Design Patterns', and ‘Don’t Make Me Think’, combined with hands-on project work and leveraging AI-driven learning methods for support and exploration. My constant aim is to improve code quality, maintainability, and overall development efficiency.

footer.description: Portfolio showcasing my skills, projects, and experience as a Junior Software Developer seeking opportunities.

blog.title: My Software Development Internship Journey
blog.description: Follow my week-by-week experiences, challenges, and lessons learned during my hands-on software development internship.

week1.title: Week 1
week1.overview: Started the internship with project onboarding. Focused on understanding the existing coding architecture (AmoDrive) and project structure, working with Storybook components, and improving coding style based on senior feedback. Gained practical experience using Git/GitHub workflows, resolved various technical errors, and successfully finalized tickets related to forms, cards, and modals.

week2.title: Week 2
week2.overview: Initiated work on the AmoTrack project, engaging with the core tech stack: React, PostgreSQL, Drizzle, and Fastify. Successfully set up the database, established connection, and developed the first CRUD endpoint. Received valuable feedback on logical thinking and collaboration. Created new endpoints, optimized server files, and started working on tickets for the user interface and API performance, gaining experience with ticket and PR workflows.

week3.title: Week 3
week3.overview: Focused on refining work based on feedback and tackling new tickets. Addressed challenges related to coding style consistency by learning from different seniors. Received positive feedback on Pull Requests and successfully completed and obtained approval for outstanding tasks from the first week. Continued developing skills in backend development.

week4.title: Week 4
week4.overview: Achieved a key milestone by presenting a demo of the AmoTrack frontend and backend development progress to the senior team. Implemented significant functions in form components and resolved backend bugs. Focused on making components more generic and reusable. Received positive feedback, motivating further dedication to project development and skill improvement.

week5.title: Week 5
week5.overview: Primarily focused on managing and addressing Pull Requests (PRs) and continuing frontend development for AmoTrack, including updating forms. Successfully finalized remaining backend tasks. Started a small personal project ('Mini Mike') based on senior guidance, aimed at reinforcing learning and practical skills.

week6.title: Week 6
week6.overview: Engaged with DevOps aspects, tackling Azure challenges and deployment issues, including optimizing 'chunk size reduction' via GitHub Actions. Continued frontend development work on assigned tickets. Collaborated with a colleague to troubleshoot and resolve deployment problems and contributed to updating the AmoStyle library. Provided constructive feedback on a colleague's project.

week7.title: Week 7
week7.overview: Dedicated the week entirely to working on the Amo-style-library. This involved rewriting existing components based on the decision to move away from using MUI, focusing on custom implementation, component testing, and library maintenance.

week8.title: Week 8
week8.overview: A quieter week focusing on integrating feedback from my interim evaluation. Continued frontend refinement based on senior advice, independently addressing and fixing bugs. Developed new UI components including input fields, radio fields, and checkbox fields, demonstrating growing autonomy. Engaged in detailed review of feedback and technical documentation.

week9.title: Week 9
week9.overview: Transitioned back to working on both the frontend and backend of the AmoTrack project after finalizing Amo Style Library tasks. Picked up new tickets assigned by the senior team, focused on implementing new features and updates across the stack. Gained experience with API documentation by creating Swagger specifications.

week10.title: Week 10
week10.overview: Shifted full focus to the AmoTrack project, actively contributing to both frontend and backend development. Updated frontend components, resolved bugs, and processed translation feedback. Further enhanced API documentation by setting up Swagger. Began implementing core backend features, including soft deletion logic for data management.

week11.title: Week 11
week11.overview: Dedicated the week to finalizing assigned tickets for the AmoTrack project. Successfully reached a major development milestone by fully implementing the complete timesheet logic, a core feature. Focused on thorough testing and preparation for upcoming demos, demonstrating ability to complete feature development cycles.

week12.title: Week 12
week12.overview: Achieved high productivity by focusing exclusively on assigned development tickets. Rebuilt and refined several pages based on new design feedback to enhance user experience and interface usability. Prepared the codebase and architecture for the upcoming implementation of the API gateway.

week13.title: Week 13
week13.overview: Focused heavily on finalization and refinement of critical application components. Completed and refined the timesheet feature, implemented and thoroughly tested the login functionality, and completed the translation of all application pages into English. Prepared to finalize user authentication flows and address remaining design feedback.

week14.title: Week 14
week14.overview: Engaged in advanced topics and codebase optimization. Conducted self-study and implemented React Query for improved data fetching and state management. Researched testing methodologies and performance optimizations. Refactored and cleaned up existing code, implemented robust role checks for access control, and further refined login functionality and the timesheet feature. Enhanced UI details by styling project components.
